title: Is Zomato Delivering ‘Girlfriends’ Now? Over 4,000 People Searched For It On New Year’s Eve - News18
summary:
Is Zomato Delivering ‘Girlfriends’ Now? Over 4,000 People Searched For It On New Year’s Eve

Date: January 02, 2025 Source: News18

On New Year’s Eve, Zomato reported that 4,940 people searched for 'girlfriend' on the app, and 40 users searched for 'bride'. These humorous searches reflect the festive mood and the creative use of food delivery apps among individuals away from home.

  • 4,940 searches for 'girlfriend' on Zomato on New Year’s Eve.
  • 40 searches for 'bride'.
  • Possible explanation related to the names of restaurants 'Girlfriend Food Court' and 'Girlfriend Arabian Mandi Restaurant'.
  • Humorous social media reactions suggest a playful interpretation of the searches.
“People are not as stupid as they are being shown to be.” - Mustafa Khundmiri on X

This light-hearted trend on Zomato highlights how food delivery apps are being utilized in unexpected ways, prompting both amusement and discussion online.
newTitle: Is Zomato Delivering ‘Girlfriends’ Now? Over 4,000 People Searched For It On New Year’s Eve

title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO Day 3 Live Updates: Issue subscribed over 199 times so far; check GMP. Apply or not? | Stock Market News - Mint

The Indo Farm Equipment IPO has captured a significant interest from investors, being heavily oversubscribed with only a day left for bidding. The IPO offers shares at a price band of ₹204 to ₹215.

title: Honda Cars India Reports 20 Percent Sales Growth In 2024 - NDTV
summary:
Honda Cars India Reports 20 Percent Sales Growth In 2024

Publication Date: 2024

Source: Honda Cars India Ltd

Honda Cars India Ltd has concluded the year 2024 with a remarkable 20 percent growth in total sales, surpassing the previous year's totals.

  • Total sales reached 1.32 lakh units in 2024, up from 1.10 lakh units in 2023.
  • Domestic sales accounted for 68,650 units, while exports were at 63,221 units.
  • December 2024 sales were 5,603 units, a 35% increase from December 2023.
  • Challenges in the domestic market were noted, attributed to uneven demand.
  • Record exports, particularly of the mid-size SUV Honda Elevate, contributed significantly to growth.
Kunal Behl, Vice President, Marketing & Sales, stated, "2024 was a mixed bag for the industry... This contributed to a remarkable growth of 20% in overall HCIL's sales."

The performance indicates a strong focus on exports and the introduction of new models, positioning Honda as a significant player in India's automotive market.
newTitle: Honda Cars India Reports 20 Percent Sales Growth In 2024

title: Auto stocks rev up as December sales surge drives Nifty Auto to a 6-month high - Moneycontrol
summary:
Auto Stocks Surge as December Sales Drive Nifty Auto to 6-Month High

Publication Date: January 02, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

December saw a remarkable uptick in auto sales, propelling the Nifty Auto index to its largest one-day gain in six months, driven by leading companies like Eicher Motors and Maruti Suzuki.

  • Eicher Motors experienced a 25% increase in December sales, reaching 79,466 units year over year.
  • The company's exports surged by 90% compared to the previous year, with over 11,000 units of Royal Enfield exported.
  • Shares of Maruti Suzuki India Ltd rallied 5% on bullish management comments regarding strong sales.
  • The Nifty Auto index gained significant traction, attributed to better-than-expected sales figures across major manufacturers.
"Eicher Motors was also the top gainer on the Nifty, rallying 7 percent following an impressive 25 percent increase in December sales."

The surge in auto sales indicates a positive trend for the automotive sector, suggesting consumer confidence and potential economic growth.
newTitle: Auto Stocks Surge as December Sales Drive Nifty Auto to 6-Month High

title: Bajaj Finance shares jump over 5% as Citi maintains 'Buy' on Q3 optimism, sees up to 17% upside for stock - Moneycontrol
summary:
Bajaj Finance shares jump over 5% as Citi maintains 'Buy' on Q3 optimism, sees up to 17% upside for stock

Date: January 02, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Bajaj Finance share price surged over 5 percent in Thursday's trade after analysts at the brokerage Citi reiterated its 'Buy' rating on the stock. The stock climbed to an intraday high of Rs 7,306.05, marking a 5.34 percent gain from its previous close.

  • Citi has set a price target of Rs 8,150 for Bajaj Finance, indicating a potential upside of 17.51 percent from Wednesday's closing price.
  • The brokerage highlighted expectations of loan growth stability and a positive bias in net interest margins.
  • Key support is coming from segments like mortgage financing and sales financing.
  • A marginal rise in credit costs is estimated between 2.2 to 2.5 percent.
"Key support is coming from segments like mortgage financing, sales financing, and new business ventures," Citi noted in its report.

This positive movement in Bajaj Finance shares aligns with the overall rise in the finance and NBFC sector.
newTitle: Bajaj Finance Shares Surge Over 5% as Citi Maintains 'Buy' Rating

title: Hyundai India announces CRETA Electric, to be offered in four variants; shares rise 2% - Moneycontrol
summary:
Hyundai India announces CRETA Electric, to be offered in four variants; shares rise 2%

Date: January 02, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Hyundai Motor India unveiled the Hyundai CRETA Electric on January 2, leading to a 2% rise in the company's shares.

  • The CRETA Electric will be offered in four variants with two battery pack options: 51.4kWh (Long Range) and 42kWh.
  • The driving ranges are 473 km and 390 km for the respective battery packs.
  • Hyundai aims to redefine the EV market in India with this model, focused on design, technology, and safety.
  • The company's shares surged to Rs 1,854 apiece on its announcement.
“This groundbreaking electric SUV combines bold design, cutting-edge technology, and unparalleled safety to set new benchmarks in India’s EV market.” – Hyundai

The launch of the Hyundai CRETA Electric marks a significant step in the company's electric vehicle strategy, aiming to inspire confidence in electric vehicles among Indian consumers.
newTitle: Hyundai India Launches CRETA Electric with Four Variants

summary:
Indian Stock Market Rallies: Sensex Gains 1,300 Points, Nifty Surpasses 24,000

Publication Date: Thursday

Source: Live Mint

The Indian stock market saw a significant upward movement on Thursday, with the Sensex soaring over 1,300 points and the Nifty 50 crossing the 24,000 mark, driven by strong buying in banking and IT stocks.

Key Points:

  • The Sensex reached an intraday peak of 79,542.69.
  • The Nifty 50 index rose by 328.45 points to settle at 24,071.35.
  • Positive sentiment was driven by increased optimism for upcoming quarterly earnings.
  • Key contributors to the surge included banking and IT sectors.
  • Global market trends and improved GST collection contributed to investor confidence.
“Domestic benchmark index Nifty opened flat on the first trading session of the new calendar year... settled the day on a positive note at 23,743.” - Hrishikesh Yedve, AVP Technical and Derivatives Research

This rally in the stock market showcases resilience and optimism among investors, reflecting positive trends across various sectors.
newTitle: Indian Stock Market Rallies: Sensex Gains 1,300 Points, Nifty Surpasses 24,000

title: Gold prices: Will 2025 be a golden year for gold? Here’s why experts are bullish on the yellow metal - The Times of India
summary:
Gold prices: Will 2025 be a golden year for gold? Here’s why experts are bullish on the yellow metal

Publication Date: [Date Not Provided] Source: [Source Not Provided]

In 2025, experts suggest that gold should remain a key component in investment portfolios due to its diversification benefits and potential for continuous gains.

  • Gold surpassed Rs 80,000 per 10 grams in 2024, with over 26% growth influenced by global tensions and interest rate anticipation.
  • Experts encourage taking advantage of price dips for purchasing gold.
  • Changes in US leadership and inflationary policies are expected to impact gold prices positively.
  • Gold has shown impressive returns over the past three years, with significant growth in 2023 and 2022.
  • Experts recommend gold form 10-15% of investment portfolios for optimal diversification.
"Gold was doing well the last time Donald Trump came to power in 2016 but saw initial hiccups after he started pursuing his policies," said Chirag Mehta, chief investment officer at Quantum Mutual Fund.

The consensus is that despite potential fluctuations, gold continues to be a critical asset amidst economic uncertainty.
newTitle: Experts Predict a Strong Future for Gold Prices in 2025

title: Jai Corp Shares In 20% Lower Circuit On Selling Land Parcel To Reliance Industries - NDTV Profit
summary:
Jai Corp Shares In 20% Lower Circuit On Selling Land Parcel To Reliance Industries

Date: 02 Jan 2025 | Source: NDTV Profit

Shares of Jai Corp. tumbled nearly 20% on Thursday after an industrial land parcel of over 5,286 acres was sold to Reliance Industries Ltd. at a valuation of Rs 2,200 crore.

  • The unit of Urban Infrastructure Holdings Pvt. Ltd. sold its 74% stake in Navi Mumbai IIA Pvt. for Rs 1,628.03 crore.
  • Jai Corp holds a 32% stake in Urban Infrastructure Holdings.
  • The sale impacted Jai Corp's share price significantly, causing a drop close to its lower circuit limit.
Reliance Industries stated, “The investment is not a related party transaction and none of the company’s promoters have any interest in this transaction.”

The market reaction reflects investor sentiment regarding the valuation and potential future gains from the sold land parcel.
newTitle: Jai Corp Shares Plummet 20% After Land Sale to Reliance Industries

title: Jai Corp Shares Tumble 20% On Selling Land Parcel To Reliance Industries - NDTV Profit
summary:
Jai Corp Shares Drop 20% Following Land Sale to Reliance Industries

Date: 02 Jan 2025, Source: NDTV Profit

Shares of Jai Corp experienced a significant decline of nearly 20% after the company sold a large industrial land parcel to Reliance Industries Ltd.

  • Jai Corp's stock fell to Rs 248.4 per share on the NSE.
  • The unit, Urban Infrastructure Holdings Pvt. Ltd., sold its 74% stake in Navi Mumbai IIA for Rs 1,628.03 crore.
  • This transaction values the entire company at Rs 2,200 crore.
  • Reliance Industries stated that the investment was not a related party transaction.
  • Navi Mumbai IIA became a subsidiary of Reliance following the acquisition.
“The appreciation potential of the land parcel exceeds the acquisition cost.”

The sale reflects significant shifts in the industrial land market and has created notable reactions among investors.
newTitle: Jai Corp Shares Drop 20% Following Land Sale to Reliance Industries

title: Sensex soars over 1,400 pts, Nifty rallies past 24,200 on Q3 earnings optimism and consumption revival:... - Moneycontrol
summary:
Sensex soars over 1,400 pts, Nifty rallies past 24,200 on Q3 earnings optimism and consumption revival: Top factors at play

Date: January 02, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The stock markets in India witnessed a significant rally on January 2, with both the Sensex and Nifty indices surging due to optimism around quarterly earnings and increased consumption activity.

  • Sensex surged over 1,400 points, reaching an intraday high of 79,917.79.
  • Nifty 50 moved above the 24,200 level, climbing 447.3 points.
  • Key sectors contributing to the rally included banking, IT, pharma, FMCG, and energy.
  • Healthy GST collection in December rose by 7.3% year-on-year, reflecting a rebound in consumption.
"Despite increased refunds for both domestic and export sectors, the robust GST collection reflects steady demand and a healthy economy." - Abhishek Jain, Partner, KPMG

The significant gains reflect market optimism driven by strong business updates and technical factors supporting the uptrend.
newTitle: Sensex and Nifty Surge on Q3 Earnings Optimism

title: Vroom! Eicher Motors shares zoom to a record high after strong Royal Enfield sales in December - CNBCTV18
summary:
Eicher Motors Shares Surge 8% Following Strong December Sales for Royal Enfield

Date: Jan 2, 2025 Source: CNBC-TV18

Eicher Motors Ltd. saw its shares increase by 8% after reporting strong sales for its Royal Enfield motorcycles in December. Royal Enfield's total sales for the month grew by 25% compared to last year.

  • Royal Enfield sold 79,466 units in December 2024, up from 63,887 units in December 2023.
  • Models under 350 cc had sales of 69,476 units, also a 25% increase.
  • Exports nearly doubled to 11,575 units compared to last year.
  • Eicher's share price reached a record high of ₹5,288.2.
“As we gear up for 2025, we are looking forward to sustaining our growth momentum...” - B Govindarajan, CEO of Royal Enfield

The company is expanding its operations globally, with the establishment of a CKD assembly facility in Bangkok and expanding its pre-owned motorcycle business to 236 cities in India.
newTitle: Eicher Motors Shares Surge 8% Following Strong December Sales for Royal Enfield

title: CreditAccess Grameen, Spandana Sphoorty shares gain up to 9% on this MFIN decision - CNBCTV18
summary:
CreditAccess Grameen, Spandana Sphoorty shares gain up to 9% on this MFIN decision

Date: January 2, 2025 Source: CNBC-TV18

On January 2, 2025, stocks in the microfinance segment, such as CreditAccess Grameen and Spandana Sphoorty, saw gains of up to 9% after the MicroFinance Institute Network (MFIN) announced a three-month delay in the implementation of new lending caps.

  • Microfinance stocks gained after MFIN's announcement.
  • The MFIN delay allows more time for lenders managing their stress and delinquencies.
  • New lending caps will now be implemented by April 1, 2025.
  • Industries related to microfinance were under stress, with overdues on the rise.
  • Shares of CreditAccess Grameen rose 9.3% to ₹973.55, while Spandana Sphoorty increased by 2.5% to ₹337.3.
“Microfinance overdues are up 110 basis points on a month-on-month basis in November 2024,” - UBS report.

In conclusion, the MFIN's decision to delay the caps offers relief to microfinance companies amidst rising defaults and stress in the sector.
newTitle: CreditAccess Grameen, Spandana Sphoorty shares gain up to 9% on MFIN decision

title: ITC Hotels share listing price can go up to Rs 300 after demerger. What brokerages say - The Economic Times
summary:
ITC Hotels Share Listing Price Projections Post-Demerger

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Economic Times

Following the demerger of ITC Ltd, ITC Hotels shares are expected to be listed at a price range of Rs 200-300 per share according to brokerage firm Nomura. The listing will occur before mid-February 2025.

  • The demerger became effective on January 1, 2025.
  • Shareholders will receive one share of ITC Hotels for every ten shares held in ITC.
  • Nomura estimates the market cap of ITC Hotels will range from Rs 42,500-62,000 crore.
  • Centrum Broking anticipates a target price of Rs 583 for ITC shares.
  • The hotel business accounted for 4.3% of ITC’s overall sales in FY24.
  • ITC holds 140 properties, operating across six brands.
“Based on discussions with multiple market participants, we anticipate that the initial market price for ITC Hotels shares will range between Rs 150-175 per share,” Nuvama stated.

The demerger represents a strategic move for ITC, allowing it to focus more sharply on its hospitality business while also attracting new investors.
newTitle: ITC Hotels Share Listing Price Projections Post-Demerger

title: Asia's factories end 2024 on weak footing as Trump 2.0 risks mount - Reuters
Gold rate today nudges higher as investors await US data for US Fed rate cut cues. US inflation in focus | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Gold Rate Today: Investors Anticipate US Economic Data for Fed Rate Cut Insights

Date: Today
Source: Live Mint

The gold rate experienced a rise in early morning trading as investors await US economic data for insights on potential Federal Reserve rate cuts. The MCX gold rate opened at ₹77,000 per 10 gm, reflecting a notable increase in international gold prices.

Key Points:

  • The gold price reached an intraday high of ₹77,074 today.
  • Spot gold is trading at approximately $2,632 per troy ounce.
  • Market observers noted a buying interest influenced by weakness in the US dollar.
  • Analyst Kyle Rodda predicts a bullish trend in gold prices driven by geopolitical risks and expectations of rising government debt.
  • The markets currently see an 11.2% chance of a Fed rate cut in January 2025.
  • Investors are advised to consider economic data on inflation before making investment decisions.
“Chances of the US Fed rate cut are looking weak after the December 2024 US Fed meeting as the US inflation still exceeds 2 percent.” – Anuj Gupta, HDFC Securities

This rise in gold prices reflects market expectations of future rate cuts, but inflation concerns lead to caution among investors.
newTitle: Gold Rate Today: Investors Anticipate US Economic Data for Fed Rate Cut Insights

title: Manufacturing PMI slips to a 12-month low of 56.4 in Dec - Moneycontrol
summary:
Manufacturing PMI slips to a 12-month low of 56.4 in December

Publication Date: January 02, 2025

Source: Moneycontrol

India’s manufacturing activity closed the year at a 12-month low of 56.4 in December compared with 56.5 a month back, according to a private sector survey released on January 2.

  • The HSBC India Manufacturing Purchasing Managers’ Index declined from 57.5 to 56.5 in November.
  • This marks the second consecutive month of decline in manufacturing activity.
  • The index averaged over 57.5 in 2024, compared with 56.8 in the previous year.
“December marks the second consecutive month of decline in activity.”

This decline in the manufacturing PMI suggests potential challenges in the industrial sector moving forward.
newTitle: Manufacturing PMI slips to a 12-month low of 56.4 in December

summary:

Honda has been seen testing its upcoming Elevate SUV, showcasing a new Black Edition that features a bold black exterior and interior design.

  • Honda's Elevate SUV has been successful, and the new Black Edition aims to enhance its appeal.

  • Expect cosmetic changes like a smoked effect on lights and a new badge.
  • Mechanically, it will retain the 1.5-litre NA petrol i-VTEC engine with 119 bhp.

In conclusion, the new Honda Elevate Black Edition is set to launch soon, promising to attract attention and potentially boost sales for Honda.

title: Gujarat Toolroom shares hit 5% upper circuit on plans to consider 5:1 bonus share issue - The Economic Times
KPI Green Energy launched its QIP the day shares hit a record high; stock down 25% since then - CNBCTV18
summary:
KPI Green Energy launched its QIP the day shares hit a record high; stock down 25% since then

Date: January 2, 2025 Source: BSE

Shares of KPI Green Energy are currently trading with gains of 2%, yet the stock has seen a 25% correction from its peak in August.

  • KPI Green Energy shares reached a record high of ₹1,118 on August 12, 2024.
  • The company plans to issue one bonus share for every two shares held starting January 3, 2025.
  • Retail shareholding increased from 1.51 lakh to 2.53 lakh during the March to September period.
  • Promotion stake reduced from 53.08% in March to 48.77% in September.
  • The Qualified Institutional Placement (QIP) was launched to raise ₹1,000 crore with a floor price set at ₹983.24.
  • For Q2 FY2025, KPI Green's revenue rose to ₹359.7 crore and net profit doubled to ₹69.8 crore.
"The stock has given positive annual returns every single year since its listing in 2019."

The volatility in KPI Green Energy's stock, alongside the launch of the QIP and bonus issues, reflects the company's significant developments in the market.
newTitle: KPI Green Energy's QIP Launch Amid Stock Fluctuations

title: Elon Musk’s bizarre name change on X turns trader’s $66 into $3M profit - Cointelegraph
Stock Split, Bonus Issue: TWIN TREAT for shareholders; RECORD DATE in January - ET Now
summary:
Stock Split, Bonus Issue: TWIN TREAT for shareholders; RECORD DATE in January

Updated: January 2, 2025, Source: ET NOW News

BN Rathi Securities has announced a stock split and bonus issue, rewarding shareholders with significant corporate actions.

  • Shareholders will receive one bonus share for every existing share held.
  • The stock will split in a 1:2 ratio, reducing face value from Rs 10 to Rs 5.
  • Record date for eligibility is set for January 24, 2025.
  • The stock has delivered an all-time return of 8,526% since May 2004.
  • Currently, shares are trading at Rs 249.95, down by 5.73%.
"Issue of Bonus Shares in the ratio of 1:1, i.e., 1 new fully paid-up equity share of Rs. 5/- each for every 1 existing fully paid-up equity share of Rs. 5/- each held by them," said the company.

This announcement reflects BN Rathi Securities' commitment to enhancing shareholder value and adapting to market dynamics.
newTitle: Stock Split and Bonus Issue Announced by BN Rathi Securities

title: Nomura Sees ITC Hotels Beat Estimates To List At Rs 200–300 A Share - NDTV Profit
summary:
Nomura Predicts ITC Hotels Share Listing Between Rs 200-300

Date: 02 Jan 2025, Source: NDTV Profit

Nomura has maintained a 'buy' rating on ITC Ltd., expecting its hotels division to outperform market estimates with a projected listing price range.

  • Nomura estimates ITC Hotels to list between Rs 200–300 with a market cap of Rs 42,500 to Rs 62,200 crore.
  • The demerger of ITC Hotels became effective on Jan. 1, with ex-demerger trading starting on Jan. 6.
  • ITC Ltd. will retain 40% ownership of ITC Hotels.
  • The share allocation ratio for existing ITC shareholders is 1:10.
  • Nomura projects ITC Hotels will have zero debt on its balance sheet.
  • The luxury hotel segment in India is experiencing a re-rating due to high demand and limited supply.
“The demerger will likely unlock value for ITC Hotels as it will be a pure-play hotel entity.”

Nomura's target price for ITC Ltd. is Rs 575, indicating a potential upside for investors.
newTitle: Nomura Predicts ITC Hotels Share Listing Between Rs 200-300
